ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Started in 1988, Sri Keshava trust(SKT) is a bangalore based public charitable trust engaged in provision of health care services to those that need it the most. Focusing on eye care in particular, Sri Keshava trust started in a small way out of Prabha eye clinic and research center. A need was felt to take diagnostic and treatment services to rural areas around bangalore, five rural ophthalmic clinics in Jigani, Anekal, Magadi, Hosur and Yelandur were started with the help of other NGOs. In 1998 the Governemnt of Karnataka granted us a civic amenity site in the new area of Banashankari III stage. Supported by over 3500 donors big and small, SKT built a statre of the art tertiary care ophthalmic center called Vittala International Institute of Ophthalmology(VIIO). This facility started offereing its services since October 2001. Sri Keshava Trust is a â€œSustainable Charityâ€ engaged in provision of eye care services primarily in the Southern Indian State of Karnataka. The Trust has its activities in clinical work, out reach programs and in research. No patient is turned away for economic reasons and no effort is stinted to be at the cutting edge of eye care in all spheres. The trust undertakes research and training in all areas of ophthalmology and is currently in the process of creating comprehensive care models. The trust has built, VIIO, a Rs.20 Crore (3.5 Million USD) super specialty charitable Ophthalmic Hospital and research center, with the help of over 3500 donors big and small. The institute focuses on clinical work, Research and Training as its core areas with main motto as Dedication is the Ultimate Goal.Sri Keshava Trust has a very clear focus on affordable quality eye care by providing cost effective access to preventive and diagnostic care through unique Advanced Eye Care Mobiles, combined with a successful economic model based on revenue sharing with existing medical establishments in the hinterland .This model piloted through three separate units for various eye conditions have proven sustainable. The aim is to increase compliance for follow-up by patients afflicted by chronic conditions like diabetes and prevent irreversible blindness before it occurs

Cordyceps are parasitic mushrooms which grow on a host insect. These mushrooms are endemic to Tibeatean plateau, and India. Cordyceps are considered as the world’s costliest, endangered medicinal mushroom with enormous nutraceutical value.Cordyceps are known to have potential health effect related to hepatic, renal, cardiovascular, respiratory, nervous, sexual, immunological systems, besides having anti-cancer, anti-oxidant, anti-inflammatory and anti-microbial activities and as energy booster

ngoList.title: Sri Venkateshwara Education Society
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sri Venkateshwara Education Society is a registered society in the year 2000 with the primary objective to promote social upliftment by providing quality education (Primary, Technical & Management). In this endeavour we started a group of institutions namely. Sri Venkateshwara College of Engineering in the year 2001, Sri Venkateshwara Public High School in 2006, Sri Venkateshwara Central School (from pre-nursery to 10th standard) in 2008 & Sri Venkateshwara PU College in the year of 2010. Sri Venkateshwara College of Engineering presently offers both under graduate & post graduate programs providing 4 year Bachelor of Engineering degree in the following streams, 1. Electronics & Communication Engineering, 2. Computer Science & Engineering, 3. Information Science & Engineering, 4. Mechanical Engineering, 5. Electrical & Electronics Engineering, 6. Civil Engineering. Master of Technology degree of 2 year duration in 1. Electronics, 2. Computer Science & Engineering, 3. Machine Design, 4. Structural Engineering. & Master of Business Administration. These programs are certified by ISO & NBA accredited (E&CE, CS&E, ME). The total strength of students is close to 2500. Also we have started research centres in all departments and centralized research wing in the name of Centre for Advance Research in Technology (CART). SVCE has 170 teaching faculty members & 110 supporting staff. Our faculty members have published research papers in national & International journals in the areas of ancient knowledge, advanced science & technology and filed patents too in these areas.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Main activity is to organise camps in various parts of Karnataka for performing free cataract surgeries for poor patients. The organisation is in existence since 1979 and run by few volunteers without any profit motive. Every year about 20 camps are organised In each camp about 150 to 400 cataract surgeries are performed. Thus, about 3500 surgeries are performed in a year. So far 40000 free cataract surgeries have been performed. Pediatric surgeries are performed for eye related ailments at Mysore. During the last 6 years more than 250 such surgeries have been perfomred for poor children free of cost.
